ratings.comment: An absolutely amazing professor, I wish I had him for every one of my ME courses.
I had him for ME 201. Super cool guy and can clearly tell he's very passionate about teaching young engineers. Would love to take again.
W professor. Lecture quizzes were easy and were collaborative, the one test in the course is easy. Expect to spend lots of time out of class on the trolley project

I had Dressler for the mechanics of materials lab (he was also my lab instructor for that class) and hes a pretty good teacher. He actually taught us relevant material that we would use after graduation, gave great advice about future classes, and cared about his students.

Gave great lectures, as the class is a little more informal since it's just an introductory class, he was a great mentor to us in labs. Gave us advice about what classes to take and such and what things would be like in the future. The class was a little disorganized but it was during covid, so he was kind of making things up on the fly.

Everyone loves Dressler because he's funny and knows his students, but he's just not a good professor. He is disorganized and frequently makes assignments with mistakes in them. He focuses heavily on concepts in lecture and asks questions without ever giving answers. The material isn't too difficult, but he doesn't teach it well at all

ME 361 is a tough class with three weekly assignments due per week. Dressler enjoys hearing himself talk most of the time and inspires "philosophical" thinking about thermodynamics rather than actually teaching the material. Lectures are not well prepared and erroneous even when he does have something relevant to teach.
Worst professor I've ever had. Is a bloody racist. DO NOT take his class. Does NOT teach, and is partial to your race. Waste of time and money.
Dress is a great guy and I really enjoy his teaching style and he actually makes the material fun. His office hours are one of the best I've ever been to
Has a very good style of teaching and is absolutely amazing outside of class. Not too much work and very fair grading. He's also extremely funny and makes the class interesting
He's just the best, lots of homework but he really teaches the concepts very well

Dressler is one of my favourite professors at the UW, he always teaches with passion, has very helpful lectures and he's even nicer outside of class. Wants his students to do well and is truly a fun professor to have

I took this class at 8:50am and I am by no means a morning person, but I looked forward to going to class because Dressler was an energized, engaging, and very helpful professor. This class is a lot of work, but taking the time to do well on homeworks genuinely helps you do well on exams and in the class in general. One of the best professors.
Dress is a great guy. He's really interesting to talk to and I like the way he teaches. He was super helpful and patient with us during labs. Lots of individual attention.
Great guy, can sometimes seem very disorganized but his lectures are some of the only ones I actually enjoy sitting through.

All of the previous reviews are correct when saying Dressler is a great guy who really cares about his students. His teaching style is a little different though. If you prefer a lot of structure, you won't get that with dress. His lectures are usually on the fly. He definitely makes class interesting and makes you want to learn though.

Dressler is one of the best professors I've had. He really cares about every student's success, however the class will definitely challenge you. His lectures are great, and he uses a lot of real world examples to help you understand the concepts better. His exams are tough, but fair, as long as you don't fall behind on the homework.

Dressler is hands down the best professor I have ever had. Amidst all the socially awkward, heavy accent, research driven, sh*t storm of professors that ME has to offer, Dressler is a breath of fresh air. He is an unbelievable teacher and he really really really REALLY cares about his students. His lectures are as entertaining as they are helpful.

This class is tough, no getting around it, but he's certainly out to *teach* you something rather than hand out A's. 3X/week homework assignments are tough but if you work through it, they help with understanding. Of all the thermo profs, he's the best choice hands down. Exams are totally reasonable. MUST get the textbook if you dream of passing

ME 361 is a tough class with three weekly assignments due per week. Dressler enjoys hearing himself talk most of the time and inspires "philosophical" thinking about thermodynamics rather than actually teaching the material. Lectures are not well prepared and erroneous even when he does have something relevant to teach.

Great professor - makes lectures entertaining, tends to stray off topic sometimes and is sometimes underprepared for lecture but makes up for it by being approachable and easy to talk to. Another plus is that he really cares about students doing well so he's always there to answer question and help with concepts.
Very cool guy, is very helpful and wants class to do well. Tries to learn the names of students in order to connect more. Dress is the ideal professor. Dont buy the textbook, it is online for free.

Dressler is the best professor I have ever had from the engineering department. He makes a real effort to get to engage students in lecture which is lively with lots of opportunity to ask questions. There is lots of homework in this class but Dressler is super approachable if you need help. If you have the chance to take Dressler for anyclass DO IT
